Description: Ostracon (?), fragment of the upper-body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel with base of one handle surviving, the fabric is partially grey-black in section, the interior is lightly spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and faint traces of one line of red-painted Coptic text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394882) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394882)
